text: The moment I break from the shield line, the snow beneath my feet gives way. Not a slip—collapse.
The Demon King’s ‘breath’ makes the ground pulse like a living thing. I step into nothingness, my knee slamming into shattered ice. White pain floods my vision.
I try to rise. Try to shout the words. But the black mist reaches my ears first. It isn’t sound—it’s command.
“Re—turn—” The syllables crawl across my throat like frozen fingers closing over my windpipe.
My mouth opens. Only broken vapor escapes. The vow never forms—like a match that never catches, snuffed out by wind.
The Demon King tilts its head. Not drawn to me—only acknowledging the extra piece on the board.
When its gaze lands, my body locks in place. Not fear—worse. Recognition. As if it has watched me fail across countless loops.
The mist tightens. No hesitation now. It surges like a tide reclaiming its shape.
I see Alicia’s fingers tremble again—this time not from exhaustion. This is what half a second costs.
“…Don’t come out.”
She turns her head just enough to look at me. No anger. Only a calm that belongs to someone already standing at the edge.
No time remains. The necklace is in her hand. The core is within reach. But the mist coils around her wrist.
She forces the chain toward the fracture in the core—yet this time, the crack seals. Black light floods upward, biting into the pendant like a living maw.
A claw descends. Not a strike—correction. As if returning her to her assigned place in the pattern.
She raises her arm to block. Her shoulder guard explodes under pressure. Blood spills dark against snow.
She steps forward anyway—closing distance with the only currency she ever spends: herself.
But this time—there is no opening.
The mist recoils and lashes outward, freezing into chains around her throat, wrists, ankles. Her body is wrenched upward, suspended before the core.
Her sword falls into the snow with a dull sound. It is louder than any scream.
Her lips move. Maybe a command. Maybe an apology. Maybe—at last—a goodbye.
The mist crushes the words before they exist. Her eyes remain bright—then slowly lose focus.
The Demon King presses her toward the fracture. Not tearing. Erasing. Like wiping a name from a page.
In the next heartbeat, Alicia vanishes into black light—necklace and all. Gone without residue.
For one suspended instant, the wind does not move. The world itself forgets to breathe.
Something tears from my throat that doesn’t sound human.
I try to run. My legs are lead. Someone shouts my name behind the shield wall—but it reaches me like sound underwater.
The barrier’s blue glow fractures, shards falling like broken glass. The soldiers’ breathing dissolves into panic.
The core in the Demon King’s chest stabilizes. No longer turbulent—perfectly aligned. The loop corrects itself.
Black mist expands in a tidal surge—over snow, over shields. The city walls groan like splitting bone.
Cold pierces my chest—as if the world has passed sentence. As darkness closes in, one thought remains: this time, I didn’t reach her.

event.message:
You stepped forward.

Half a second too late.

She was erased.
The loop corrected.

Time realigned.
The world continued.

And you remained on the wrong side of it.

—— The Vow That Never Landed · BAD END ——
